intro: Ossaea spicata, commonly known as the spiked ossaea, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Ossaea spicata thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
